column1: '''Farewell We Call to Hearth and Hall!''' is a song that was sung by [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] at the house in [[Crickhollow]] after the "conspiracy" of [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo's]] friends was revealed.  Merry and Pippin had composed it for the occasion
column2: modeling it and setting it to the same tune as the [[Far over the misty mountains cold|dwarf-song]] that [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]] had heard in [[Bag End]] at the start of his adventure.  After it was sung Frodo praised the song and took the line "We must away ere break of day" literally

column1: ==Text==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Farewell we call to hearth and hall!
Though wind may blow and rain may fall
We must away ere break of day
Far over wood and mountain tall.
To [[Rivendell]]
In glades beneath the misty fell
Through moor and waste we ride in haste
And whither then we cannot tell.
With foes ahead
Beneath the sky shall be our bed
Until at last our toil be passed
Our journey done
We must away! We must away!
We ride before the break of day!
</poem>
